Node.definition: = to experience a deep loathing for a person or condition

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= action by which humans stop resisting a certain event from happening

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: bitter; hence: = state in which humans are in deep distress

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

Node.gloss: to declare guilty|to condemn as guilty
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities declare (other) humans guilty before God or humanity, ◄ as a result of (allegedly) having acted in a way that is contrary to the law

Node.gloss: to make known|to show|to inform|to tell|to teach
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire information about (other) humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= action by which humans initiate a possible argument or conflict with other humans or with a deity by accusing them of wrongdoing or by taking action in a different way
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events
= action by which humans are engaged in laborious work which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion

literally: palm of the hand, but used in a figurative sense with the focus on the activities that are performed with one's hands; = someone's actions, whether or not performed with one's hands, for which one is personally responsible
literally: to shine (on); hence: = action by which deities look on something with approval, ◄ as if their eyes shine upon it
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= living creature, including both humans and animals; ◄ conceived as an object that mainly consists of flesh; ≈ regarded as weak and passing

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
primarily found in poetic contexts: = human being; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
= action by which humans make an intensive effort to obtain in depth information about a certain object or event
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= action by which humans or deities make an intensive effort to obtain in depth information about a certain object or event
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= state in which humans are or are considered to be in a state of guilt before God or humans, ◄ as a result of (allegedly) having acted in a way that is contrary to the law

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
= causative action by which humans or deities produce humans or images portraying deities
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= state in which multiple events are connected

= causative action by which deities or humans cause other humans and objects to be removed from existence in a violent way, as if by swallowing up, either by direct intervention or by accomplishing this through the hands of others

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind

= stiff tenacious earth; ► material of which bricks, pottery, and even man himself is made; ≈ buildings made with this material are regarded as relatively weak as opposed to buildings made of stone; therefore it is also seen as relatively worthless material
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

Node.gloss: to make (someone) return to dust|to cause (someone) to die
Node.definition: literally: to bring back to dust; hence: = causative process by which deities cause humans to die so that their body decomposes and they become one with the earth
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

= white fluid; ◄ secreted by women and female mammals; ► for nourishment of their children or young; also used as food for humans; ≈ highly appreciated and considered high quality food; associated with delight, whiteness, purity, wealth, and well being; metaphor for beauty, young age; quality, wealth, and sex
= a substance made from the pressed curds of milk, starting as a liquid and slowly gaining substance; ► used as food; ≈ used metaphorically to denote the growth of a baby's body in the mother's womb
= causative process by which deities cause liquids to become relatively more solid than before ► and so flow less easily or completely stop flowing
= the thin layer of tissue forming the natural outer covering of the body of a person or animal
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat
= causative action by which a deity covers an object with another object, ◄ as if it were a layer of clothing
= any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength
= a piece of tough fibrous connecting tissue uniting muscles to bones ► and so forming the inner framework of the body

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary

= the air that is taken in and expelled through the lungs by humans and animals, which makes them live, and which distinguishes them from inanimate objects like idols; ≈ regarded as coming from God; sometimes God is depicted as a breathing being as well
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
literally: to store up events in one's mind; hence: = action by which deities decide in their minds to carry out a certain event in the future
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether or not on purpose, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

Node.gloss: to clear the guilty|to hold not guilty|to let one go unpunished
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities pronounce or consider a person innocent or cleared of wrongdoing and freed from punishment
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= state in which humans are or are considered to be in a state of guilt before God or humans, ◄ as a result of (allegedly) having acted in a way that is contrary to the law
exclamation expressing grief and dismay

Node.gloss: to prove to be righteous|to be just|to be in the right|to be innocent
Node.definition: = state or process by which humans and deities are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior
literally: to lift up (one's) face or head); hence: = action by which humans look up without shame

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities
literally: satiated (with an event); hence: = process by which humans become more than fully engaged in a certain process or activity, which can be either good or bad
= state which provokes disdain from the general public or from a specific category of people ◄ due to one's behavior or condition

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves
= action by which humans raises themselves up or lift up part of their body; ≈ associated with pride
exact meaning unsure; possibly: = male lion (אֲרִי) that is no longer living with its pride and wanders around alone

= causative action by which humans or animals make an effort to capture or kill (other) animals, sometimes with the help of devices such as weapons and traps; ► usually with the intention of killing and eating them; ≈ implies using stealth to locate and pursue the quarry, often used metaphorically to refer acts of aggression towards people or events to get other people in one's power
= causative action by which humans replace one person by another person, involved in the same activity ◄ as if the first person was renewed
= action by which humans provide evidence or proof that something has taken place or that some decision has been made
= state in which human experience displeasure, which is said to reside in their heart (לֵב) ◄ and is caused by their own condition or by someone else
= individual or group of people that is to replace another individual or group of people and take over his/her/their duty
= relatively large group of people, usually with centralized leadership; ► assembled for a common purpose, such as warfare or a journey

= part of the lower body of women and mammals where offspring are conceived and in which they grow until their birth; ≈ sometimes extended to refer to a woman, the time of birth, the place where something is produced, and the innermost part of an area
literally: to bring out (from the womb); hence: = causative process by which deities cause children to be born

Node.gloss: to expire|to breathe one's last|to perish
Node.definition: = process by which a human being breathes his last breath, ◄ either as a result of a natural cause or of an unnatural cause, ► resulting in death

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

= place where one or more people are buried, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, stench and decay, uncleanness
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or inanimate objects to move or be moved from one place to another
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= relatively low frequency of events or short duration of an event
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= causative action by which deities or humans stop performing an ongoing event
= action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration
= process by which a flash of light appears and brightens up the surrounding world; ≈ associated with joy and suddenness
= a marker pointing to the time preceding a particular point in time
= process by which someone is going to die, described as a movement in one way only
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

literally: shadow of death, only found in poetry; hence: = state in which there is a total absence of light ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer to distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, fear, death, and oblivion

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

Node.gloss: land of only darkness > world of the dead
Node.definition: = literally: the land whose darkness is gloom, i.e. a reference to the world of the dead
= state of total absence of light; ≈ associated with suffering and death

literally: shadow of death, only found in poetry; hence: = state in which there is a total absence of light ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer to distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, fear, death, and oblivion
= process by which a light bearing object gives out or reflects a bright light
= state of total absence of light; ≈ associated with suffering and death
